page.title: 19STOKE ORCHARD MONUMENTS
page.content: {18th Century monuments -}one dated 1706, the rest are mid 19th Century. At Stoke Orchard the earliest tomb stone is 1863. There are 4 headstones dated 1942-1944, of 4 members of the R.A.F who were killed at differant times on the war-time airfield in Stoke Orchard. {Rev. Harrison}has been in charge of the Parish for 11 years. Altogether there are approximately 500 parishoners. In both churches there are about 20 people who attend regularly and quite a number who come occasionally. At Stoke Orchard the figures for 1984 1985 END OF JUNE Baptisms 4 2 Marriages 3 2 Burials 0 2
